intro: Cuphea bustamanta f. reipublicae, commonly known as the flame flower, is a unique hybrid plant within the Lythraceae family. It is characterized by its striking, tubular, brightly colored flowers that range from red to orange, resembling flames. The plant is native to Mexico and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its foliage is typically dark green and glossy, adding a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms.
